header.type: HUMAN RIGHTS VIOLATIONS, SUBMISSIONS QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS

testimony: Thank you very much Mr Mbengo.  I would now call Wilson Vandoyi.
I would like him to take an oath Mr Chairman.

Thank you Mr Vandoyi for coming in front of this Commission.  Revd Xundu will take you in oath in the name of the Truth Commission and he will be the one asking you questions on behalf of the Commission, thank you.
Chairperson and the President of this Commission gives me this opportunity to ask you questions.  What is your clan name sir?
Thank you.  In your statement you said you were staying in the men's hostel.  Were you there with your family or alone?
I was staying there with my family.
On this day on which you were arrested, you said you heard the shots being fired, can you please tell us what happened on that day?

On that day I went out of my house at about four o'clock.  I went out of my house after four o'clock and I went through the Douglas Street.  I went through the Douglas Street, when I was approaching the hostel, I heard shots being fired.
What time was it at that time?

It was after four o'clock, but I'm not sure, but it was before half past four.  I hears shots being fired, while I was still looking around, I heard the bullet in the back of my arm.
 I fell down.  It was still, the sun was still light, it was not dark.  I didn't see the people who were shooting me.  I just heard noises from the hostel.  I was still conscious a little bit at that time.  People from the hostel said that the person who was shot should be taken.  Two policemen came and I had the bullet inside my body.
 I wanted to stand up but I couldn't.
Where did the police take you?
They took me to the hospital.

I was semi-conscious but when the police came to me, I regained my consciousness.  While I was in the van, the police van I was unconscious.  I didn't know where I was.  I regained my consciousness at night in the hospital.
I regained my consciousness in the hospital at night and I was feeling pain and I was also afraid.
You got scared, and did you sleep over at the hospital?

I didn't know where I was.  On the morning I slept two weeks in the hospital and we went home.  Before I went home, I slept there on Friday.  On Monday it was the third day, three policemen came and they were wearing green clothes and they were called the Green Barrets in the township.
 They asked me my name and I told them.  They asked me
DUNCAN VILLAGE HEARING TRC/EASTERN CAPE
3 W VANDOYI
other things but I don't clearly remember.
No, I don't know who they are.
Did they come back on the 18th as you've said in your statement?

Yes.  After the three policemen went, the other two policemen came the same day.  They asked details and they went.
 On the 18th they came to my house and they told me to go to Frick Street and I went there on the morning, on the 19th.  I went there on the morning of the 19th.
What happened in Frick Street?  Did you give any statements?
The policeman who brought me from home.
I think his surname is Qoboshiyane.

Yes, I did, but I firstly asked the question before writing the statement.  They said that the statement concerns the way I was injured.  They asked me whether I knew the people who shot me and then I said no.
Did you really not know the people that shot you?
Did you know whether they were policemen or just ordinary people?
I know they were policemen, because they were in the police van wearing green clothes.

I want you to be clear, I don't want you to
DUNCAN VILLAGE HEARING TRC/EASTERN CAPE
4 W VANDOYI
say you don't know whether they were policemen or what, I want you to be clear and specific.  Do you say you were shot by policemen or ...
After submitting my statement I went to Jeram.
Yes, after submitting my statement.  I told him what happened.

Yes, I was.  He asked me questions of whether I know these people and then I told him that I don't know this policeman, I was just on my way, I didn't see any van.  I didn't see any police van, I just saw it when they took me with it to the hospital.  He tried to submit this claim but he said that I don't have a witness.
What about the people from the hostel who saw you?  Did they come to give evidence?
No, they did not.   I went to them, those who said they saw me when I was shot, but they didn't go there.
In other words you didn't get any witness to support your story?
Did you go to Black Sash?

I went to one Doctor, but I forgot his name,
DUNCAN VILLAGE HEARING TRC/EASTERN CAPE
5 W VANDOYI
he gave me Mr Lalla.
Yes, he's a lawyer.  I received a letter from Mr Lalla calling me to come to his office.  But the case was difficult because he said I didn't have a witness and I don't know who shot me.
In your statement to Officer Qoboshiyane, did you tell him that you were shot by policemen?
When you were making your statement to Mr Qoboshiyane?

Yes, I did tell him that I was shot by policemen, but we didn't have a witness.  I told Mr Qoboshiyane that I was shot by policemen.  And after taking the statement he came to take me to the place where I was shot and I showed him that I was sleeping there.
At this time it was the time of political activities.  Were you a member of any political organisation?
No, I was not a member.  These people shot you when you were alone.
Were you alone or were there any other people with you?
I was alone at that time.
Were you working at that time?
You were staying there with your wife?  You were staying in the hostel with your wife?
I didn't say I was staying in the hostel.
Were you not staying in the hostel?

No, I didn't stay in the hostel, I was just DUNCAN VILLAGE HEARING TRC/EASTERN CAPE
6 W VANDOYI
passing the hostel on my way to Duncan Village.  I was staying in Duncan Village.
As a result of that, do you have any problems with your shoulder?
Yes, I do because my arm cannot work properly.  I had an operation.
Did you work after this incident?
Do you have any other means of support now?
No, but I tried to apply for a pension and I succeeded at that time.  But now they told me to go to the Doctor in order to receive more pension.
Do you have any request to the Commission?  Although we are not deciding the one who are deciding what to do with the people's cases, but will you please just tell us your request.

My request to the Commission is since I am unable to work at this present time, I can't even - I can't work with my arm because it is so painful.  My request is that I have five children and I would like the Commission to educate my children.
The first one is in standard 8, the second one is in standard 7, the third one is in standard 3, the fourth one is in lower standards and the last one is not at school.

Any questions?  You were behaving yourself during the day so I hope that you will behave until the end.  DUNCAN VILLAGE HEARING TRC/EASTERN CAPE
7 W VANDOYI
There are situations which need to be laughed, but please don't do that for a long time.  We'll give this opportunity to Mr Ntsikelelo Sandi to ask questions.
Thank you Chair.  Mr Vandoyi, I would like to ask you some questions in order for me to get some clarity on what really happened.  Firstly do you know who shot you?
Do you have any suspicions of who shot you?
No, I don't have any suspicions, I was just on my way - there is no one who I can say who might shoot me.
You said this happened on the 28th of November 1986?  Were there any other things happening here in Duncan Village?
No.  There was nothing happening on that day, there was no toyi-toyi on that day.
On the spot where you were shot, was there any conflict between the people and the police?
No, there was no conflict.  There was nothing on that day, there was no toyi-toyi.
The people who saw you being shot, what did they say?

The ones I went to they just said they saw me when I was taken by the police, the two witnesses.  When I went to them, they didn't want to go to the lawyers.  When I went to them, they didn't want to come out, they were so scared.
These are the people who said you were shot by the police?

What were they afraid of?
DUNCAN VILLAGE HEARING TRC/EASTERN CAPE
8 W VANDOYI
I don't know, but it seems as if they were afraid of being arrested. One of them said so.
Do you know where we can reach these people?
I wrote their name when I was submitting my statement.
Thank you Mr Vandoyi.  Thank you Mr Chairman.
Mr Vandoyi, you said the two witnesses was so important in the story, you know their names?
I don't see their names in your statement, can you please give us their names?  I don't see their names in your statement, will you please give us their names?
They are Mlulami Jwambi.  Mlulami Jwambi.
Sonwabo Xoko.  Sonwabo, the surname is Xoko.
Do you know where they are staying?
Yes.  They are staying here in Duncan Village.  They are staying in Mgaleni Section.
Why did they refuse to support you since they have this important information about your story and their information seems to be the only one who can help this case to continue?  Why did they refuse?
They said they were afraid, they were scared of being arrested, because at that time people were arrested a lot.  In 1986 people were arrested when testifying.
Since we are free now, why are they still afraid?

When I submitted my statement, I wrote their names.
DUNCAN VILLAGE HEARING TRC/EASTERN CAPE
9 W VANDOYI
Were they afraid at that time?
Yes, they were afraid before we got freedom.
Thank you.  Dr Kahn, as you have mentioned him in your statement, was he the Doctor who examined you after you got injured?
Yes, he also sent me to Mr Lalla.

I think he left this place, he is in Cape Town.  He was here in day, in day hospital then, but he is in Cape Town now.  Maybe you'll find he's there in the hospital although he's gone.  My file is still there, I forgot something.  After I went, going to Jeram, I didn't get my file in the hospital.
 I looked for it, but I couldn't find it, and they made me a new one - the second one.  I couldn't find the first file.

Thank you Mr  Wilson Vandoyi for submitting the statement.  As we have already said, we would like as a Commission to meet with these two witnesses and we will also try to investigate and to find out where are the files for Dr Kahn so that we can get details.
 We'd like to thank you for bringing this forward.  This is our chance to try to continue with your case.  We will try by all means to try and help you with your case.  Thank you.
